PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_SwitchingDeviceTypeStarter
PropertySetDef.Definition: A starter is a switch which in the closed position controls the application of power to an electrical device.

PropertyDef.Name: StarterType
PropertyDef.Definition: A list of the available types of starter from which that required may be selected where:\X\0D \X\0D AutoTransformer: A starter for an induction motor which uses for starting one or more reduced voltages derived from an auto transformer. (IEC 441-14-45)\X\0D Manual: A starter in which the force for closing the main contacts is provided exclusively by manual energy. (IEC 441-14-39)\X\0D DirectOnLine: A starter which connects the line voltage across the motor terminals in one step. (IEC 441-14-40)\X\0D Frequency: A starter in which the frequency of the power supply is progressively increased until the normal operation frequency is attained.\X\0D nStep: A starter in which there are (n-1) intermediate accelerating positions between the off and full on positions. (IEC 441-14-41)\X\0D Rheostatic: A starter using one or several resistors for obtaining, during starting, stated motor torque characteristics and for limiting the current. (IEC 441-14-425)\X\0D StarDelta: A starter for a 3 phase induction motor such that in the starting position the stator windings are connected in star and in the final running position they are connected in delta. (IEC 441-14-44)
